title: Traits: Rust's Interface System for Query Engine Components
description: Translates C++ abstract classes and virtual functions into Rust traits. Covers trait objects, static vs dynamic dispatch, downcasting with as_any() (like C++ dynamic_cast), TypedColumnRef for type-safe dispatch (like std::variant), and macros for visiting column types (like std::visit).

title: Generics and Trait Bounds   Building Typedcolumn
description: Deep dive into Rust generics for query engine design. Covers trait bounds, associated types vs generic parameters, type-safe dispatch with enums and macros, conditional implementations, and when to prefer concrete types over generics.

title: Async Rust From Iterators to Streams
description: Transforms the synchronous CsvDataSource into an async implementation. Covers why async matters for I/O-bound query engines, the Future trait, async/await syntax, the Stream trait as async Iterator, and patterns for concurrent data processing.

title: Rust Ownership for C++ Engineers
description: Translates C++ memory management concepts (RAII, unique_ptr, move semantics) into Rust's ownership model. Covers the key mental shifts a C++ developer needs to stop fighting the borrow checker and start thinking in Rust.

title: Modeling Expressions with Enums and Pattern Matching
description: Uses Rust's algebraic data types (enums with data) to design Token and Expr types for an expression evaluator. Shows how pattern matching replaces C++ virtual dispatch and visitor patterns with exhaustive, compiler-checked code.

title: Building a Recursive Descent Parser in Rust
description: Implements a complete lexer and recursive descent parser for arithmetic expressions in Rust. Covers string slices, iterators, the Peekable adapter, Result/Option for error handling, and ownership patterns in parser state.
